Phunting

Jesus would be an aspect of God, an avatar if you will. Part of, but not equal to the whole. Just as your arm is not 'you', but it is part of you.
 
 This is what people (IMHO) mean when they say Jesus is not God. They don't mean he has nothing to do with and is unconnected to God, just that he is not commensurate to the whole. I don't see why this would mean Mary was a lying whore.
 
 (Oh and of course, personal opinion? Myth all the way baby!)

Big Orn

On earth, things that cannot be accepted or understood, need to be killed or, at least, dishonored/disgraced. That is not really the intelligent, civil way of handling it, but common none the less.
 
 John 1:1 – In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
 
 We seem to take all things as we can digest them physically and that being Cradle to the Grave. The Word was not born, but has always been. Jesus is = I Am. When Moses asked who God was, God said, “I Am”. All through the Gospels, Jesus says, “I Am…”. What we as humans seem to miss is that the promise God made was fulfilled when He sent His son Jesus to be born of the human race. We “miss” it because we cannot understand it. As long as we continue to misunderstand the basics of Christ, we will always have the wrong idea(s) of who He was and still is.
 
 There is no Triune God (Trinity). There is only one: Isaiah 45:5, “I Am…the Lord, and there is no other; there is no God besides Me.”
 To explain what God meant when He said, “Let us make man in our image…”, He is talking about His Majesty.
 
 Of course, this resides in that bubble between our ears, put there either by the written word or orally. If you cannot digest it in your Spirit-man, then you cannot digest John 10:30 where Jesus says. “I and Father are one.”
 
 Jesus is God.
